lines.text: I want that article out of Spicy Bits, and I want it out NOW.
Will you put the gun down please?
Have you never read Mc Nae's Guide? That article is malicious rubbish.
Tell me who's the real owner of this blackmail rag and maybe we can make a trade.
Do you smoke it or take it in the arm? I'm the owner!
lines.character: Frank Locke, an alias of Cecil Dawson

lines.text:
[Banging on door with other policemen]
Open the door! We want to see Perry Mason!

[On the inside of the locked door]
Man, who do you think you are?
Herbert B. Jones of the homicide squad.

[shouting]
Open that door, or we'll break it down!
Well, uh, wait'll I put my pants on, will yuh?
You've had enough time to knit a pair.

[Hanging up the phone perplexed, Perry sees the houseboy by the door]
Muh lad, I'll have that glass of Scotch you offered.

[Initially puzzled, but he regains his wits]
Scotch?... Oh, yes. Me too, sir.
Down South is a thousand miles as the crow flies, but I'm no crow.

[Sarcastically after Spudsy inadvertently sets fire to Perry's fee]
Well, Spudsy, I've always wanted to light a cigarette with a thousand-dollar bill.

[Opening the door]
Welcome, Mrs. Belter. Won't you come in?
Why - I thought this was Mr. Mason's suite... Mr. Perry Mason. Who are you?
I'm the coroner. We're expecting his death momentarily.
